bug.author: MaxHalford
bug.summary: audio widget not working on Safari
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have successfully managed to deploy a streamlit application on Heroku, which you can see <denchmark-link:https://chime-soundboard.herokuapp.com/>here</denchmark-link> . I'm really happy about it; streamlit is really revolutionary. The problem is that the st.audio widget doesn't seem to be working on Safari. The soundboard I've linked works fine on Firefox. I haven't tried it out with Chrome. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Clone chime and navigate to it python -m venv env source env/bin/activate pip install poetry poetry install streamlit run soundboard/soundboard.py
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The audio widget should work out of the box with most browsers. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8095957/95370525-2e247a00-08d9-11eb-897c-4a5346f19518.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
/ <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.67.1 Python version: 3.7.4 The Heroku soundboard is build with a GitHub, which you can see here OS version: MacOS Catalina 10.15.5 Browser version: Safari 13.1.1 (15609.2.9.1.2); Firefox version 80.0
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Keep up the good work!

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MaxHalford>@MaxHalford</denchmark-link> Thank you so much for the report. Can you test on the streamlit-nightly? You can install it by uninstalling streamlit and run . To explain the problem, Safari requires the server to support <denchmark-link:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Range_requests>Range Requests</denchmark-link> . We found this problem with regard to videos, so I am sure this would apply to audio See <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/1804#issuecomment-687328551>#1804 (comment)</denchmark-link>
If things work correctly, this change should appear in the next release
Thanks for your comment <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kmcgrady>@kmcgrady</denchmark-link> ! Indeed the issue if fixed with the nightly build. Cheers!
